conclusion: Two harmonic transverse waves propagate along the positive and negative directions of the x-axis.
Wave sources are located at x=-0.2m and x=1.2m, both waves have a wave speed of 0.4m/s and an amplitude of 2m.
Particles P and Q at equilibrium positions x=0.2m and x=0.8m just begin to vibrate at t=0.
Equilibrium position of particle M is located at x=0.5m.
Wave 1 propagates along the positive x-axis from x=-0.2m.
Wave 2 propagates along the negative x-axis from x=1.2m.
The distance between the two sources is 1.4m.
Both waves travel at a speed of 0.4m/s, their relative speed is 0.8m/s.
The time t it takes for the waves to meet is 1.75s.
The two waves meet at t=1.75 seconds.
